sections.name: Gray Gardener Assassin
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Night of the Gray Death pg. 20
link.alt: Night of the Gray Death pg. 20

link.name: Night of the Gray Death pg. 20
link.alt: Night of the Gray Death pg. 20

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Human
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the human ancestry. Humans are a diverse array of people known for their adaptability. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by humans.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

link.name: Night of the Gray Death pg. 20
link.alt: Night of the Gray Death pg. 20

automatic_abilities.name: Anonymity
automatic_abilities.text: The Gray Gardener assassin has a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks and saving throws to conceal their identity and a +2 circumstance bonus to their Deception DC against effects that ferret out information about the Gray Gardener's identity.

automatic_abilities.name: Requirements
automatic_abilities.effect: The Gray Gardener assassin takes 3d8 mental damage, and the saving throw is a success.
automatic_abilities.text: The Gray Gardener assassins's features are obscured by a mask or hood;

reactive_abilities.name: Gardener's Resolve
reactive_abilities.trigger: The Gray Gardener assassin rolls a failure (but not a critical failure) on a Will save against an effect with the mental or fear trait

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Trip
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Trip with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Trip using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

traits.name: Reload
traits.text: While all weapons need some amount of time to get into position, many ranged weapons also need to be loaded and reloaded. This entry indicates how many Interact actions it takes to reload such weapons. This can be 0 if drawing ammunition and firing the weapon are part of the same action. If an item takes 2 or more actions to reload, the GM determines whether they must be performed together as an activity, or you can spend some of those actions during one turn and the rest during your next turn.

ability.name: Instant Opening

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

ability.text: The Gray Gardener assassin distracts a creature within 30 feet, using a few choice words or gestures. The creature is flat-footed against the assassin's attacks until the end of the assassin's next turn. Depending on the distraction, this action gains either the auditory or the visual trait.

ability.name: Mark for Death
ability.text: The Gray Gardener assassin designates a single creature they can see and hear as their mark. This effect lasts until the mark dies or the assassin uses Mark for Death again. The assassin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to Seek the mark and on Deception checks to Feint against the mark. The assassin's melee and ranged Strikes gain the deadly d8 weapon traits when attacking the mark.

ability.name: Poison Weapon

traits.name: Manipulate
traits.text: You must physically manipulate an item or make gestures to use an action with this trait. Creatures without a suitable appendage can’t perform actions with this trait. Manipulate actions often trigger reactions.

ability.requirement: The Gray Gardener assassin is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand
ability.effect: The assassin applies a poison to the weapon.

ability.name: Quick Draw
ability.text: The Gray Gardener assassin Interacts to draw a weapon and then Strikes with that weapon.

ability.name: Sneak Attack
ability.text: The Gray Gardener assassin deals an additional 6d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

ability.name: Surprise Attack
ability.text: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are flat-footed to the Gray Gardener assassin.
